description: What’s it like to be the son and the daughter of the Father of Lies? Find out as Daimon Hellstrom and his sister, Satana, face the worst of two worlds! Can they save their souls along with the world? Featuring Exorcists, Cyclists, Nihilists and Ice Demons! Secrets of Ancient Atlantis revealed! Guest-starring Spider-Man, the Thing and the Human Torch! Collects GHOST RIDER #1-2, MARVEL SPOTLIGHT #12-24, SON OF SATAN #1-8, MARVEL TWO-IN-ONE #14, MARVEL TEAM-UP #32 and #80-81, VAMPIRE TALES #2-3, HAUNT OF HORROR #24-25, and MARVEL PREMIERE #27.
The desk data handbook contains biographies of several Joe and Cobra characters. They are written in a personal, first-person style by General Joe Colton.
name: G.I.Joe: Data Desk Handbook

description: Updated biographies from the files of Joseph Colton, as well as new entries for several more Joe and Cobra characters.
name: G.I.Joe: The Data Desk Handbook A-M

description: More updated biographies from General Colton as well as entries for several additional Joes and Cobras.
name: G.I.Joe: The Data Desk Handbook N-Z

description: Future Raphael attempts to protect an orphaned baby from the Foot Clan.

The story of a young man who repeatedly attempts to commit suicide, and is referred to a psychiatrist. However, his life is forever changed when he meets Tanith, a young exotic dancer with a dark and disturbing secret.
name: Dhampire

description: All the pieces fall into place as Jack Hawksmoor uncovers a plot that spells doom and slavery for mankind. To stop it, Jack will have to get to seventeen cities around the globe in under twelve hours. But he's tied to a chair, cut off from his powers, and his only ally is in cahoots with the bad guys. Can he do it?
name: Highways & Byways

volume.name: The Secret History of The Authority: Jack Hawksmoor

description: The Death Judges are manipulating the Joker into freeing them to kill again. And again and again.
name: Die Laughing Book 1

description:
The Super-Sons are in an Old West ghost town and Superman Jr. lost his powers!

Reprinted in: Superman/Batman: Saga of the Super Sons (2007)
name: Town of the Timeless Killers

description:
Writer Ron Marz (GREEN LANTERN) and artist Greg Tocchini (1602: New World, Thor: Son of Asgard) continue the new adventures of Kyle Rayner! Will Kyle survive an encounter with the Thanagarian bounty hunter sent to hunt him down? And, why have the Guardians of the Universe forbidden all Green Lanterns from coming to Ion's aide?

A Thanagarian bounty hunter wants Kyle to pay for his crimes - but will his power as Ion pose a larger treat?

Oa- Soranik Natu treats Garmin Vid for his injures recieved by Kyle Rayner, while Kilowog, Torquemada and other Green Lanterns look on. As Kilowog prepares to fly off and talk to Kyle about what he did to Garmin Vid, he is stopped by the Guardians who forbid any Lantern from interfering with what Kyle is doing. Kilowog gets angry but obeys the Guardian's orders.

Earth- Kyle battles Tarra Karn, a bounty hunter, who has been hunting Kyle for the murder of the population of a planet in the Quinilon System. When Kyle learns why she is hunting him he snaps and almost kills her, but stops himself. He disarms the bounty hunter then flies off world to check her story.

Sector 3521- Kyle sees the damage he supposedly did earlier and freaks out again.

Sector 3503- Ariana is fighting a gladiator, when Kyle crash lands destroying the arena killing everyone but Ariana. When she approaches him, Kyle seems confused and aggressive. Before he can hurt Ariana green light erupts from his chest and Kyle flies into space begging for help. While floating in space he comes in contact with Mogo.
name: Torch Bearer, Part 2

description:
Torn between the way he's been and the strange force he seems to be becoming, Kyle Rayner is drawn to the one Green Lantern who may be able to help him find his way: Mogo, the planet-sized emerald warrior! Will Kyle find what he needs, or is he in a world of trouble?

Will Kyle find the answer he needs from Mogo, or is he in a world of trouble?

Oa- Kilowog, disobeying orders contacts Hal Jordon and asks him to check on Kyle Rayner, after hearing some mysterious actions on Kyle's part.

Sector 2261.142.M, Mogo- Kyle wakes up and sees a vision of Alex, who tells that this vision is about him not her. Then Donna Troy comes to Kyle and tells him he is just changing much like she did, when she came back from the dead. Then Jade appears and tells Kyle that the Starheart is part of him now and to except it. Then Major Force appears and tries to attack Kyle but he is not afraid and Major Force crumbles. Kyle then takes off his ring and uses the power of Ion to power-up.

Sector 3503- Hal Jordon on the trail of Kyle, meets Ariana who still holds a grudge for what Kyle did earlier.
name: Torch Bearer, Part 3

description:
1. The Glass Nightmare (Superboy, Lana Lang, Ma and Pa Kent / written by Leo Dorfman)

"For what you did to me, Superboy, hear my dying curse! From this moment on, every super-deed you perform will bring you closer to your grave!"

2. Dial H for Hero (Robby Reed / written by Dave Wood : reprinted from: House of Mystery #156)

3. One Legionnaire Must Go! (Legion of Super-Heroes / written by Cary Bates : reprinted in: Legion of Super-Heroes Archives #10)

Was matter Eater framed?
name: The Glass Nightmare; One Legionnaire Must Go!

description:
1. Cover by Nick Cardy.
  2. "Last Jump of a Skyjacker" written by Leo Dorfman, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Lois Lane, Morgan Edge)
  3. Vince Colletta Biography 1/2 column text piece in the Jimmy Olsen's Pen-Pals letter column.
  4. "The 3 who Vanished" written by Leo Dorfman, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Jimmy Olsen as Mr. Action, Superman)
name: Last Jump of a Skyjacker / The 3 who Vanished

description:
1. Cowboy Boots (Mickey Mouse, Goofy : inside front cover)

2. Mickey Mouse and the Inca Idol Mystery (Mickey Mouse, Goofy)

3. Secret of the Pyramids (Mickey Mouse, Pluto, Black Pete, El Cad)

4. Power Lifting (Mickey Mouse, Goofy : inside back cover)

5. Car Phone (Mickey Mouse, Goofy : back cover)
name: Walt Disney's Mickey Mouse : The Inca Idol Case

description:
An astonishing issue guest-starring Green Lantern! His power seemingly out of control, Kyle Rayner has retreated from the universe. But, when Hal Jordan arrives with questions, the result is a battle royal that will reveal just how powerful Kyle has truly become!

Sector 0937, Allistra- Kyle Rayner is destroying the Khund army, and would keep on destroying them but is stopped by Hal Jordon.

Oa- The Guardians of the Universe are still arguing over the fate of the Torch-Bearing. Some what to tell him about his true destiny. Others believe if he is too weak to find it himself then he wasn't worthy of the power anyway.

Sector 0937- Hal continues to talk to Kyle but Kyle doesn't seem to recognize his friend. Kyle talks about feeling like two people and seems calm, until Hal suggests he goes to Oa. Kyle freaks out and attacks Hal again. It takes all of Hal's power to subdue Kyle and when he tries to scan Kyle with his ring he learns that it is really Nero in disguise.

Mogo- Kyle emerges from a green egg deep inside Mogo.
name: Torch Bearer, Part 4

description:
1. An Alaskan Cache (inside front cover)

2. Undercover

3. The Wrong Map

4. Morse Code Mantrap
name: Sergeant Preston of the Yukon

description:
1. [Balloon for Cicero] (Porky, Cicero, and Petunia Pig : inside front cover)

2. The Isle of Missing Ships (Porky Pig, Sylvester)

3. Porky Pig to the Rescue (Porky, Cicero)

4. [What Is It?] (Porky and Cicero Pig : inside back cover)

5. [Petunia borrows Porky's Car] (Porky and Petunia Pig : back cover)
name: Porky Pig in The Isle of Missing Ships

description:
Green Lantern and Ion - side-by-side against one of their greatest foes! With the source of Kyle's strange behavior finally revealed, how will our heroes deal with the consequences? Meanwhile, on Earth, the outcome of one of Ion's recent battles has unexpected repercussions for Kyle's new friends.

Earth- Marrissa finds Tarra Karn's space ship and Tarra finds Marrissa.

Outer Space- Hal Jordon is faced with a beaten and confused Nero. When Hal tries to question Nero he lashes out and overpowers Hal. That is when Kyle Rayner shows up and helps Hal. The pair seem to be able to fight back Nero, but he lashes out again and knocks Hal for a loop. Kyle gets in close and over powers Nero once again but when he asks Nero questions Nero just mumbles. When Hal comes to he tells Kyle that the Guardians might have answers to what Nero was up to and that the Guardians forbade any Lantern from helping Kyle. Kyle then heads to Oa and Hal to Earth.

Oa- The guardians prepare for Kyle's arrival.
name: Torch Bearer, Part 5

description:
The Guardians reveal their secret plan for Kyle Rayner, but will he embrace his new destiny ... or rebel against it?

Oa- Torquemada and Garmin Vid are reunited just in time to see Kyle Rayner, with a bound Nero in tow, return to Oa. After explaining to the two Lanterns that is was Nero, disguised as Kyle that attacked them Kyle goes to see the Guardians. Inside the Guardian catheral, Kyle demands answers. The Guardians explain that Kyle is the Torch-Bearer and that they could not allow any other Lanterns to help him because they needed to know he could handle the power.

When Nero awakes he panics and ranting that he could not be near the Guardians, because that what he wants. Nero then starts to explode but Kyle uses the power of Ion to stop the blast and save the Guardians. They thank him, in there own way and send him back to earth to learn how to use his powers.

Earth- Marissa is being escort to Tarra Karn's ship to be kidnapped off world when Kyle arrives and save her. He then throws Tarra off world and Marissa runs back to the Notch. When Kyle returns to his studio a man off panel points at him and tells him he should not be alive.
name: Torch Bearer, Part 6

description:
Ion returns to Earth! But with a mysterious cosmic entity monitoring him from afar, Kyle's and our planet may not be safe. The next chapter in the Ion saga starts here!

Now that Kyle knows his role in the Guardians' cosmic scheme, how will he resolve his life on Earth?

Radu's Coffee Shop,New York City- Kyle Rayner tells Coffee shop owner and friend Radu about the events of the last couple days. Radu shows how much he knows Kyle by saving him the last dounut. Radu also gives Kyle a necklace Jen left behind when she moved out.

The Kaaterskill's Notch- Kyle is confronted by a Monitor, who seems confused that Kyle is alive. The Monitor talks about having to check in on the others, but before Kyle can gets answers the Monitor disappears. Later while talking to Schuyler, Kyle explains that he is still trying to keep his distance from Marissa, even though she seems to be flirting with him, in her own special way.

Battery Park, New Headquaters of the JSA- Kyle and Alan Scott talk about the death of Jade, and how she is now a part of Kyle. Alan is happy for Kyle that Jade is still with him and happy for himself for having found his son again.

New York City- Effigy finds Kyle flying through the city and ambushes him. During the battle Kyle questions Effigy's motives and learns that Effigy doesn't know why he is attacking Kyle. This adds to Kyle's theory that someone is out to get him.

Sector 3503- Kyle finds himself chained up with Ariana, saying only, "things have not worked out like I planned..."
name: Home Again

description: During any given week, the crises faced by New York’s first family of super heroes can range from the profoundly cosmic to the deeply personal. Today, in this stand-alone issue, an employee from Fantastic Enterprises will come to Susan Richards for help, claiming that her son is being abused. And Reed Richards will be asked to keep a promise he made to a dying man months ago. Great jumping on point!
name: Private Lives Public Faces

description: Fantastic Enterprises is ready to go public, and to mark the occasion the FF agrees to an outrageous publicity stunt: Drafting an honorary fifth member to join their team. Ten young super-heroes "compete" for the spot, but only nine of them have honorable intentions. Unlucky Number Ten will stop at nothing to win--and to get his or her hands on the secrets of the Fantastic Four. Guest-starring The Invincible Iron Man!
name: The Super Hero's Apprentice, Part 1: Fallout

description: After 30 fantastic issues, the little series that could comes to an end. In our last issue, the Fantastic Four’s honorary fifth member, a young super hero with dark intentions, believes he is heir to throne of...Latveria? To prove himself to Dr. Doom, he is determined to take down the FF once and for all—and on National Television!
name: The Super Hero's Apprentice, Part 2: Open House

description: On planet Velmar V, the invincible Ikilles has already trashed Timber Wolf and Shadow Lass. Now, the Legion's last hope is — Invisible Kid?! Meanwhile, while the rest of the weary, wounded Rimbor Team fights an army of heavily armed Science Police, Atom Girl squares off against the vicious Commodore. And on Earth the mysterious M'Rissey awes everyone with his unexpected power!
name: Enemy Rising, Part 5: Operational Calculus

description: When Hal Jordan is visited by the Guardian Ganthet, he learns the Guardians most shocking secret and faces off against a renegade Guardian whose machinations threaten the existence of the universe.
name: Ganthet's Tale

description:
Overview:

Witness the stories that led up to the landmark wedding of two classic DCU heroes in this collection featuring material from BIRDS OF PREY #109, BLACK CANARY #1-4, and the BLACK CANARY WEDDING PLANNER!
name: TPB

volume.name: Green Arrow/Black Canary: Road to the Altar

name: Die Laughing Book 2

description: The Ultimates and Super Soldiers from other countries make their final stand against Thor. Without a moment's hesitation, it's an all out super human brawl with Captain America and Captain Britain tackling Thor. Fortunately,Thor is called a god for a good reason. While gathering his strength, Thor unleashes his wrath against those he once called allies. Quicksilver dashes forward to get the belt from Thor, but is electrified by lightning. It seems futile to continue, but with Peitro's sister harmed, Quicksilver launches forwards and removes Thor's belt leaving him powerless. Thor is later taken into custody at the Triskelion, where he is confronted by his half brother Loki.
name: The Passion Play

description: The penultimate issue of volume two gives us answers to long-standing mysteries and brings us closer to the epic conclusion to "Grand Theft America"! With the traitor revealed and the Triskelion in ruins, the remaining Ultimates must unite to defeat an invasion force bent on establishing a new world order. But with the team shattered, who will lead the charge?
name: America Strikes Back

description: Doctor Bruce Robert Banner is final trailed for his actions as the Hulk. "Matt Murdock", as Bruce's lawyer defends him as hard as possible, but eventually the jury's decision was made. Bruce Banner was later tricked into thinking that he won the trial at the Triskelion by Nick Fury, but was incapacitated by drugged wine. Banner is later left for dead on a Helicarrier that was set to blow miles away from any major cities. Just before the bomb hits though, the Hulk is awakened. Not long after Captain America gives a speech at Bruce's empty funeral as the Ultimates and S.H.I.E.L.D. are surprised to find that they were the only people in Banner's life. After surviving the explosion, Bruce finally contacts his friend Hank Pym and tells him thanks as he walks off down a crowded street in a foreign country.
name: The Trial of the Hulk

description: Nick Fury has dispatched the Ultimates to take down thier most powerful member Thor! S.H.I.E.L.D. is convinced that the Thunder God is a former mental patient who's far too dangerous to be loose and the awesome Asgardian is doing little to dispel that notion. Meanwhile, things are heating up between Tony Stark and Natasha Romanov. And we mean heating up.
name: Brothers

description: Hank Pym has left the Ultimates and is working with a new super hero group known as The Defenders while taking on the identity of Ant-Man. The Defenders, made up of Powerman, Valkyrie, Son Of Satan, Hellcat, Nighthawk, and The Black Knight, hope to be the world's new favorite Superhero team. On top of that, Hank strikes up a relationship with the 19 year old Valkyrie, and attempts to give new technology to Nick Fury, who declines. Later, The Defenders learn about a group of teenagers who are planning on stealing from a warehouse late at night. After setting up the proper media connections, The Defenders split up and patrol the district around the warehouses. Nighthawk is injured by the teenagers in a botched ambush, with Giant Man narrowly saving him. Unfortunately, Hank is photographed as a 60-foot nude man, which further damages his credibility and puts him on thinner ice with S.H.I.E.L.D. due to them owning the rights to the growth formula. Finally, after learning that The Defenders are not who they said they were, Hank is visited by the S.H.I.E.L.D. operative that has been leaking high security files to the media.
name: The Defenders

description: Captain America leads the Ultimates into a third world middle eastern country where they disarm and destroy the country's nuclear stockpile. Thor continues to stick with his apparent delusions about being the God of Lightning, and warns Tony Stark of a war that Nick Fury is leading the world into. Meanwhile, Wasp's relationship with Captain America begins to go south and she reopens contact with her ex-husband Hank. Finally, Hawkeye's family is put in danger as the mysterious traitor moves against him.
name: Wolf in the Fold

description: Tony and Natasha are on the eve of their wedding...but the mysterious traitor that's been plaguing the team has other plans--and the team will never be the same! Also, Captain America and Wasp hit a serious snag in their relationship...is this the end for the Ultimate Universe's hottest couple? But believe us when we tell you that everything turns on its head with this issue! Is this the beginning of the end for the Ultimates?
name: Born on the Fourth of July

description: With the devastating revelation of the traitor in the Ultimates, the team is reeling in shock! But even that sad situation can't stop wedding bells from ringing for Tony "Iron Man" Stark and Natasha "Black Widow" Romanov. Make sure to bring your invitation-to action! Part 3 (of 6)
name: Grand Theft America

description: Despite all the globe-girdling surveillance information and awesome firepower of S.H.I.E.L.D and its super-powered army—the Ultimates—the unthinkable has happened! An unknown enemy with unimaginable power and an unstoppable force of will is at our shores... Will hope rise from the ashes of defeat, or is this truly the end for the Ultimates? Part 4 (of 6)
name: Axis of Evil

description: It's all-out action as The Ultimates take the battle to the alien infiltrators - the deadly Chitauri! And in this struggle against overwhelming odds, there WILL be casualties. But will that include a member of The Ultimates? ANYTHING can happen in the Ultimate Universe ... and usually does!
name: Persons of Mass Destruction

description: This conclusion to the ULTIMATES' first volume is so epic it needed more pages! Will the Chitauri alien invasion finally succeed or will the full firepower of the Ultimates be enough to stem the tide? And wait'll you see Ultimate Hulk on the rampage to end all rampages!
name: How I Learned to Love the Hulk

description: A single, tiny gene, hiding deep within teenaged Warren Worthington's DNA, sprang to life one day, and changed the world forever. Now explore the never-before-witnessed dawn of Warren's new life as a mutant and hero.
name: Senior Year Book 2 of 5: Hell Night

description: Warren Worthington III thought he had it easy. Wealthy upbringing, posh prep school, hot girlfriend…but all of that ended when wings started growing from his back! Now the young man who will be Angel of the X-Men is embarking on his first adventure, and discovering what makes him a hero. Written by Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa (SENSATIONAL SPIDER-MAN) with groundbreaking art by Adam Pollina in his stunning return to the X-Men!
name: Senior Year Book 3 of 5:

description: In the wake of Excalibur's break-up, Brian Braddock and his wife Meggan at last lead "normal" lives. But their peace is shattered when Brian learns that a mysterious knight has decimated his birth planet, Otherworld. Now only Captain Britain, and his companions Psylocke and the Black Knight, have a hope of bringing this fiend down! But it will be a quest that will test Brian like never before, and force him to confront untold horrors and his own inner demons!
name: Camelot Lost

description: With Otherworld under seige, a small group of warriors lead by Captain Britain embark on a hunt for Excalibur, the mythic Sword of Power, which may be their only hope of salvation!
name: The Ruined Land

description: Captain Britain returns in a tale of furious fantasy in the Mighty Marvel Manner! The only thing that stands between the evil goddess Roma's total domination of reality is the sword of might, Excalibur! Can Brian Braddock, Psylocke and the Black Knight reclaim it in time?
name: Destinys Children

description: Captain Britain's arch-nemesis has stolen the ultimate power in the universe right from Brian Braddock's hands! Can even the last surviving members of the Captain Britain Corps stop him before it's too late?
name: Heir Apparent

description: X-Men vs. X-Men! After their attack on Alpha Flight, Colossus and his team are wanted fugitives! Worse, they’ve become addicted to the insidious drug known as Banshee! Now it’s up to the other X-Men to take them down. Yes, it’s mutant vs. mutant! When the X-Men go to war with each other, who wins? Plus, the startling revelation of Jean Grey! Where did she go after defeating Apocalypse? Find out here!
name: Absolute Power, Part 3 of 4

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
Kyle visits a remote world of barbaric splendor, intending to make amends for the destruction they believe he caused. But Kyle finds himself confronted by drawn swords and a very angry princess! And the cosmic being who's been watching from the wings makes his move!

Kyle Rayner: Warlord!

The Monitors discuss the fate of Kyle Rayner, and can't come to a conclusion on if it is better for him to live or die. One points out it might be a moot issue as Kyle is flying to Alytt and may not be alive much longer anyway.

On planet Alytt, Kyle learns of Ariana's fate to battle the Kingdom of Hiddai's champion and offers to take her place. Kyle and Ariana are then chained up until the arrival of Viceroy Urchak, the leader of the Hiddai. Urchak excepts Kyle as the champion and knocks him out.

When Kyle awakes he is in the Arena awaiting to fight the Champion who turns out to be a 12 foot tall multi-armed beast. Kyle defeats the monster but refuses to kill him, this causes the Viceroy to get upset but then Kyle uses the power of Ion to put him in his place.

Back in Ariana's home kingdom of Agaron, Ariana tries to give herself to Kyle physically but Guy Gardner shows up unexpectedly and tells Kyle he needs to go to Earth, his mom is sick and it is not looking good.

On Oa, the Guardians try to get answers out of Nero, but learn his mind has been wiped and they can't discover who is out to destroy them.

Meanwhile in California, two boys have found a Green Lantern that begins to glow.
name: Princess of Alytt

description:
Kyle confronts a major new DC threat that's headed toward Earth! Meanwhile, someone very close to Kyle is dying.

Kyle has a very unexpected run-in with the Flash and the Atom!

California- Kyle Rayner talks to Doctor Mahdavian about Maura Rayner's condition. The Doctor has run dozens of test and although he has ruled out cancer he still can't discover what is making Maura sick. After doctor leaves the room Kyle talks to his comatose mother and explains he should be around more often. Then expectantly one of the Guardians projects himself into the hospital room and demands that Kyle come to Oa, Kyle refuses at first but when his mother wakes up and tells him he should go she'll be find Kyle decides to go.

As he is leaving Earth something pulls him mentally to the shoreline where he finds a destroyed tree house. As he looks for survivors he is blind sided by The Flash and Atom of the Tangent Universe. After a brief battle that ends with Kyle unconscious the Flash and Atom, then place the Green Lantern's lantern on Kyle and The Green Lantern, of the Tangent Universe appears.

Meanwhile the Monitors see what has transpired and have decided Kyle Rayner must die.
name: Off on a Tangent

description:
The all-powerful Dark Stone - a magical stone and ruler of the dark side - awakens after a 50-year respite. When it falls into the hands of the evil Demon Card, the world is in terrible danger.

A sacred stone called Rave and its master Shiba are the only defense against the Dark Stone's evil powers. Yet, Shiba loses control over Rave after he is mortally attacked by a Demon Card assassin. With the dark side looming, a boy called Haru may be the world's single hope of revitalizing Rave and escaping the clutches of evil.

Story and art by Hiro Mashima.

Chapter Titles

  • Rave: 1 - Opened Map
  • Rave: 2 - Guiding Bell
  • Rave: 3 - Red Signal
  • Rave: 4 - Stairway to the Unknown
  • Bonus Comic: RAVE0077
name: Vol. 1

description: This issue was a Wizard exclusive 0,5 issue, taking place between Flash #219 & 220. It is also a prologue to Rogue War (Flash #220-225).
name: Rogue War Prologue: Tricksters

description: BOOM!’s first horror-romance continues! The Terror of Rumson continues to stalk high-schooler Molly, intent on making her dreams come true—and eager to use a chain saw to do it! THE DAILY SHOW staff writer Brendan Hay continues to bring a HEATHERS-meets-CARRIE sensibility to his horror series debut!
name: 2 of 5

description:
It’s probably a bad sign when Hercules comes asking for a favor. It’s juuuuuust a little job that needs doing, but this is Hercules; isn’t he supposed to be REALLY good at doing labors himself? Before they know it, Iron Man, Spider-Man and the are stuck looking after Orthus and Cerberus, the two legendary hounds of the underworld! Luckily, the dogs learn to behave after chewing up only a few cars, a statue, and Iron Man, and finally they’re obedient enough for the Metro Dog Show! Only problem, Hercules wants the dogs back. Oh no, Herc, not before the Hulk gets his ribbon! It’s two dogs with five heads between them, and all the action you can handle.

Three superheroes on their day off? A certain god says otherwise! Hercules needs their superpowers to watch his dogs while he's away. Seems like a simple task.. until Cerberus and Orthus, legendary guardians of the underworld, burst through a wall. While Spider-Man and Iron-Man desperately want to refuse, Hulk loves dogs, and Hercules won't take no for an answer. Two over-sized canines make for one big, messy adventure through New York (and its drool-ridden rubble), with a surprisingly minuscule end.
name: Best Of Show

description: Like the title character of his first major job, The Flash, Wieringo hit the comic book industry running. Armed with a fresh, unique style all his own—merging elements of manga with the power of the Marvel comics of his youth—he quickly became a fan-favorite. His work featuring Robin and Superman, Spider-Man and the X-Men—not to mention the creator-owned world of Tellos—has cemented him as one of the top artists in the business. And his recent run on Fantastic Four ranks among the best in the title’s long and prestigious history. Now Todd Dezago and Eric Nolen-Weathington give you an inside look at the artist’s life and career! This 120-page volume presents his most comprehensive, career-spanning interview to date, and is jam-packed with tons of rare and unpublished artwork, including an 8-page full color gallery.
name: Mike Wieringo

description:
Doctor Strange, Earth's Sorcerer Supreme, recruits three young witches, Jennifer Kale, Topaz and Satana, to find the mysterious Tome of Zhered-Na, which threatens to destroy the entire world! Featuring stunning artwork by new AMAZING SPIDER-MAN penciler Mike Deodato Jr.!

Spoilers

Andy Kale begins working at the New York Public Library for an archivist named Lou. Lou shows Andy a special vault containing rare occult tomes, and warns him extensively about misusing them. Andy inspects one old book known as the Tome of Zhered-Na and unwittingly unleashes a demon.

Across town at Dr. Strange's Sanctum Sanctorum, Stephen Strange experiences a powerful mystic backlash as he suddenly becomes aware of the fact that the tome has been activated. He knows that the book is bound to the Kale family and that only a member of the Kale bloodline can open it. As such, it stands to reason that only a Kale can seal it. Dr. Strange embarks upon a mission to gather three powerful witches to aid him in his new mission.

His first recruit is his former student, Topaz. His second recruit is Jennifer Kale. Jennifer proves to be more problematic than the passive Topaz, but commits herself to the mission when she discovers that her younger brother is involved. Strange tells Jennifer and Topaz that a powerful demon known as the Hellphyr has breached the dimensional plane between Earth and the netherworld and must be stopped. Returning to his sanctum, Strange calls upon his third and final recruit, the daughter of the devil – Satana.
name: The Gathering

description: Doctor Strange, Earth's Sorcerer Supreme, recruits three young witche, Jennifer Kale, Topaz and Satana, to find the mysterious Tome of Zhered-Na, which threatens to destroy the entire world! Featuring stunning artwork by new AMAZING SPIDER-MAN penciler Mike Deodato Jr.!
name: The Brood

description: Ratman heads out to stop Dead Willie and the Elementals must defend themselves in a court.

1. Wraparound cover by Jim Aparo.
  2. Splash page by unknown.
  3. "Whom Gods Would Destroy!" (Part 2) "Seven Million Hostages" (Part 3) "The Final Vision!" (Superman and Batman) written by Bob Haney, penciled by George Tuska, inked by Vince Colletta, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Milt Snapinn.
  4. "Primal Scream!" (Black Canary and Green Arrow) written by Gerry Conway, penciled by Trevor Von Eeden, inked by Vince Colletta, colored by Jerry Serpe and lettered by Shelly Leferman.
  5. "The Race is in the Running" (Green Arrow) written by Gerry Conway, penciled by Trevor Von Eeden, inked by Vince Colletta, colored by Jerry Serpe and lettered by Clem Robins.
  6. "Beware Mr. Wrinkles!" (The Creeper) written, penciled and inked by Steve Ditko, colored by Jerry Serpe and lettered by Todd Klein.
  7. "The Devil and Captain Marvel" (Captain Marvel and the Marvel Family) written by E. Nelson Bridwell, penciled by Don Newton, inked by Kurt Schaffenberger, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Shelly Leferman.
  8. "The DC Feature Page" one page featuring "It's a Bird It's a Plane It's Answer Man!"
  9. "DC Profile #44" featuring Howard Chaykin.

Notes:

  • 64 pages with no ads.
  • Flame Arrow, Grappling Hook Arrow, Net Arrows (from the Arrowcar), Suction Cup Arrow, Flare Arrow and Grenade Arrow used.
  • Roy Harper and Arrowcar flashback appearances.
  • Arrowcar sold at an auction for $100,000 and was destroyed by Green Arrow with a Grenade Arrow.
  • The Creeper story takes place in Gotham City.
  • Letter column contains a letter from Mark Waid.
name: Whom Gods Would Destroy! / Primeval Scream! / The Race is in the Running / Beware Mr. Wrinkles! / The Devil and Captain Marvel

description:
1. Superboy's First Mission! (Superboy, Ma and Pa Kent / written by Leo Dorfman)

2. The Living Ghost! (Superboy, Ma and Pa Kent, Lana Lang / written by Leo Dorfman)

3. Big Race for a Mini-Hero! (Super Baby, Ma and Pa Kent / written by Leo Dorfman)
name: Superboy's First Mission! ; The Living Ghost ! ; Big Race for a Mini-Hero!

description: Crisis on campus! The time: 1970. The place: Earth. The situation: Critical! Comic book legend John Byrne continues his first-ever Star Trek miniseries, featuring the enigmatic interstellar spy Gary Seven and his intrepid assistant, Roberta. Following their encounter with Kirk and the Enterprise crew, the duo must go undercover in the Halls of Ivy as students burn their draft cards and National Guard troops patrol the quad. What is the terrible truth behind rumors of an army of super-soldiers -- whose purpose may be much more sinsister than fighting in the jungles of Southeast Asia?
name: My Name Is Legion

description:
1. "The Strange, Second Life of Jimmy Olsen" (Jimmy Olsen, Superman) written by Leo Dorfman, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. Reprinted in: The Best of DC #46.
  2. "Secret of the Forbidden Face" (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Morgan Edge) written by Cary Bates, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger and inked by Vince Colletta.

Notes:

  • A letter to the editor from Bob Rozakis.
name: The Strange, Second Life of Jimmy Olsen / Secret of the Forbidden Face

description: IDW Publishing's Star Trek: Second Stage continues! A story from one of the most popular corners of Star Trek canon, the Mirror Universe! In the "Mirror, Mirror" episode from The Original Series, an evil Kirk commanded the I.S.S. Enterprise for the Terran Empire. But how did he rise to power, in a universe where treachery is rewarded as much as accomplishment? Witness Mirror-Kirk's plot to unseat Captain Pike and seize command!

Akisha, the soldier from the future, reveals some details of her background - but she's still searching for answers to her present! Stranded with Enemy Ace and the others on a hostile island, will any of them live long enough to learn the truth about the war that time forgot?
name: Contact

description:
1. My Diary (inside front cover)

2. Jealousy Is Strictly for the Dogs

3. My Boyfriend Always Drops In When I Least Expect It...

4. Rained Out

5. Owlie Olson ... Boy Genius

6. Foreign Atmosphere

7. My Diary... (inside back cover and back cover)
name: Susie Q. Smith

description: Nothing in the previous issues has been what it seemed as the true hijacker of the Paradox stands revealed, and Captain Calhoun finds himself face-to-face with the mastermind behind the entire plot. There are only two questions to be faced: Can he stop his opponent... and does he even want to?
name: Turnaround, Part IV

description: While Science Police search parties ransack The Legion’s headquarters, two away-teams of Legionnaires fight like cornered wolves against vicious enemies. Meanwhile, Brainiac 5 sells out the Legion’s greatest secret! New villains, stunning action and the LSH is shut down!. Plus, the introduction of Ikilles and Cazhmir! The Ikonns! The Peril Men! And more!
name: Enemy Rising, Part 4: The Leader Who Lost the Legion

description:
1. Space Academy : The University of the Planets! (inside front cover)

2. Training Flight to Titan

3. Mars (factual article inside back cover)

4. Space Scene pinup (back cover)
name: Tom Corbett, Space Cadet

description:
1. Testing a Canoe (inside front cover)

2. Easter Eggs

3. Uncle Jack Comes to Visit

4. Swiming Pool

5. Sandy Trap (inside back cover)

6. Tail Tale (back cover)
name: Walter Lantz Oswald the Rabbit

description:
Concluding the 2-part "Body and Soul!"

Wildcat's fighting abilities have been stolen from him and will be sold on the black market to the highest bidder. In order to get back into the ring, Wildcat will have to rely on a little help from his friends - the Justice Society of America!
name: Body and Soul, Part Two: Soul

description:
When Oscar Greenberg was a mere child, he was visited by the dark Lilith, who tried to steal him as her own, but his mother chanted the three sacred names of the angels, and Lilith fled. Later the young Oscar is again visited by Lilith at the time of his Bar Mitzvah.

As an adult Oscar works as a writer and meets Denise Keaton while doing research on a satanic cult, the two instantly feel a connection and would go on to have a romantic encounter. Denise not being able to control herself looses control and bites Oscar feeding on him, 3 days later he rises as a vampire.

After his rebirth into the world as a vampire Oscar continues his writting and still continues seeing Denise who he falls in love with and they cohabitate over ten year period. While researching his next novel he comes across a vampire cult with deadly outcomes.

Oscar Suffers with a bout of writers block, so he tries his hand at cimena, where he encounters Evie a young inspiring actress or so he thinks, who is this mysterious actress and what are her true motives? read and find out.
name: Greenberg The Vampire

deck: A Daredevil graphic novel by Frank Miller. Published in 1986, it builds upon Miller's previous work on Daredevil, providing further insight into the relationship between Daredevil and Kingpin.
description:
Frank Miller explores the push and pull nature of Kingpin and Daredevil's relationship. Vanessa Fisk represents all that the Kingpin holds dear; when the woman he loves is in grave danger, Fisk will act savagely to save her. All's fair in Love and War, and for Kingpin the saying’s particularly true!

Frank Miller builds upon his Daredevil run with this graphic novel, further expanding upon the antagonistic relationship between Kingpin and Daredevil.
name: Daredevil: Love and War

description: While leading the Thieves Guild, and planning to loot a king's treasure, Conan and his cohorts must elude a fearsome creature called "The Mother of Darkness".
name: Conan the Reaver

description:
We begin with Ben on Yancy Street, having just taken a tomato in the kisser from a local teenager. Afer a quick flashback to tell us the origin of Ben and the rest of the Fantastic Four, we resume with Ben chasing down the kid and his friends only to be unexpectedly teleported away.
     Meanwhile, out in the deserts of Utah, a sculptor is just finishing his masterpiece- a sculpture of Ben Grimm as the Thing, probably about 50 foot high. Unfortunately, the Hulk is bounding through that same desert, and finds and destroys the statue. After a quick pause to learn the origin of the Hulk, we find the Hulk angrily smashing the statue, declaring "Hulk hates Rockman!" As the Hulk turns on the sculptor, Hulk is also unexpectedly teleported away.
     The Watcher assumes the role of narrator, and we learn that the Thing and the Hulk have been pulled to the planet of Matriculon by Stamben Malelet, a local bureaucrat. He needs some people to deliver a document to an important scientist from the clutches of a local criminal, and those people need to be large, rugged, and not too smart. So, he's chosen our heroes.
     The Thing and the Hulk materialize on Matriculon, and we're told the Hulk is being bombarded with "positive cerebral ions"and will remain relatively calm for the next day. The two are then offered, in effect, two wishes if they'll retrieve the scientist. These wishes include the possibility of both Ben and the Hulk being premanently restored to their human forms. Ben eventually agrees, but the Hulk doesn't care. Ben tells the Hulk he can promise him something if he helps- a "good time," and the Hulk agrees.
     So, on a planet full of aliens in a far distant solar system, the two set off on foot cross-planet to try to locate the missing scientist...
name: The Incredible Hulk and the Thing in The Big Change

description:
Tony Stark sits alone, in a dark room, watching the Virtual Valerie Show. Stark turns to the day's news. The top story concerns the upcoming sale of Stark's Iron Man armor designs to the Japanese corporation, ESON. The controversial decision is followed by a profile of Stark, a billionaire recluse, now known to be the face of Iron Man. Stark dons the latest iteration of the Iron Man armor. Iron Man receives a call from a Mister Jones Jones voices his reservations about shopping Stark technology to a Japanese company. Iron Man calls Maxie Graham, a research scientist based at The Mariana Trench Undersea Research Station.

.Iron Man wishes to celebrate the sale of his technology. Graham is willing, but only if Iron Man, as Stark, meets her in Hawaii. A Dreadnought steals valuable technological information. Nicholas Fury, the former director of S.H.I.E.L.D., is called out of retirement, to rattle some cages. Fury accuses Japan, represented by Hiro Matsui, a top executive at ESON, of unleashing a virus to pirate technology. Fury calls on Stark. Fury questions Stark's decision to sell his armor technology to ESON. Stark has dinner, in Hawaii, with Graham. Their time together is interrupted by Jones.

There has been no communication with ESON since they received the final delivery from Stark. Fearing his technology may have fallen into the wrong hands, Stark journeys to Tokyo. Stark takes steps to maintain normalcy within his company. Stark meets with Keiko Takimoto, his personal escort and translator. Hideo Shinoda, the head of ESON, assures Stark that all is well, while voicing his umbrage that Stark would insinuate otherwise. Takimoto vouches for Shinoda's character. Takimoto tries to aid Stark in relaxing. Stark, and Takimoto, are attacked by an assassin.

Takimoto defends Stark, ultimately killing the assassin. Fury, leading S.H.I.E.L.D., arrives on the scene, to offer Stark protection. Stark foregoes his injection of Perpetuon, a drug that keeps him young, to regain his intellectual sharpness. Stark dons the Iron Man armor, to resolve the situation himself. Takimoto provides Iron Man with detailed maps of Tokyo. Iron Man confronts a Dreadnought. Iron Man breaches the Dreadnought's cyber defenses, discovering that the intelligence stealing virus was created by his own man, Bill Bates, at Stark International, but modified by Shinoda.

Iron Man meets with Takimoto, to pick up a drone suit of his armor. Iron Man, and the drone armor, storm the ESON building. Matsui demands that Shinoda resign as head of ESON. Matsui reveals that he framed Shinoda, as part of a scheme to return honor to Japan. Shinoda refuses to resign. Matsui orders Shinoda's murder. Iron Man enters the room. Iron Man suppresses Matsui's underlings. Matsui calls in a cadre of armored men, outfitted with Stark's technology. Iron Man calls in the drone, to even the odds. An epic battle ensues. Ultimately, Iron Man, and the drone, are triumphant.

Iron Man confronts Matsui. Matsui deploys a black box that takes control of the drone. Matsui dies in an explosion that destroys the ESON building. Iron Man pursues the runaway drone. A total systems failure takes Iron Man out of the chase. Stark regains consciousness on an island. The combination of Matsui's mysterious black box technology, coupled with Stark's own brilliant design, has inexplicably given the drone sentience. Now possessing free will, the drone sets off to find it's place in the world. Stark is rescued by S.H.I.E.L.D. Stark swears off Perpetuon, resumes his relationship with Graham, and ceases being a recluse. Periodically, Stark receives letters from the drone, a son reaching out to it's father.
name: Iron Man: Crash

description:
New York City. Donald Blake, a surgeon, sits in a bar, dejected, drinking the pain away from losing a patient. A woman, drawn to Blake's suffering, sits down next to him, and engages him in conversation. The Lady Sif enters the bar, and offers Blake his enchanted walking stick. Blake angrily orders Sif to return to Asgard. Blake's poor treatment of Sif nearly incites a bar brawl. Blake furiously returns the walking stick to Sif, who finally departs. Blake leaves with the woman, and spends a drunken night in her bed. Sif observes Blake's amorous encounter with the mortal woman. Upon waking, Blake finds that Sif has placed his walking stick next to the mortal woman's bed.

Blake races up to the rooftop. Flailing the walking stick about his head, Blake angrily rails against his father, Odin. After petulantly rejecting the woman's efforts to comfort him, Blake strikes the walking stick against the ground, triggering his transformation into Thor. Gathering the mortal woman into his arms, Thor gives her an aerial tour of Manhattan. The Lady Sif returns to Asgard. Odin expresses his concerns to the Grand Vizier. Odin fears his son is dangerously close to renouncing his Godhood, that he may live out his days as a mortal man. Sif confirms Odin's fears, while also expressing her belief that Thor no longer loves her. Odin does his best to comfort Sif.

Thor tries to explain his love of humanity to the mortal woman, but his words fall on deaf ears. The woman is smitten with the spectacle of being Thor. Thor leaves the woman, and flies across the city, taking in the full spectrum of mortal life. On his sojourn, Thor rescues construction workers, stops a robbery, and douses a tenement fire. Thor walks the streets of Manhattan, trying to connect to humanity. Thor flies into space, and hurls his hammer away. In sixty seconds, Thor becomes Blake. The hammer, once again a walking stick, returns to Blake. Lacking the fortitude to commit suicide, Blake grabs the walking stick, strikes it against his shoe, and becomes Thor.

Sif confronts Thor. Striking his hammer against the ground, Thor becomes Blake. Blake attempts to show Sif the simple, yet complex, joy of a mortal life. Sif tolerates a host of indignities to appease Blake. Try as he might, however, Blake cannot get Sif to perceive the mortal world as he does. In Blake's apartment, Sif spurns his advances, put off by his frail mortal form. Blake angrily rails at Sif, for not understanding that Blake is not merely a disguise, but the mortal aspect of the god, Thor. Sif storms out. Blake receives an emergency call, to return to the hospital. In the operating room, haunted by the death of his last patient, Blake finds that he cannot perform the surgery to save the child's life.

Sif confronts Blake. Sif reminds Blake that were the child jeopardized by a more physical threat, Blake, as Thor, would stop at nothing to overcome the peril. Blake draws strength from his immortal side, and returns to the operating room. Odin is content that Thor has reconciled his two selves. Odin plots further tests to keep his son in line.
name: The Mighty Thor: I, Whom The Gods Would Destroy

description:
Jack, The Ripper, departs London, for the United States of America. Jack, The Ripper, resumes murdering woman. One night, while burying his latest victim, at a construction site, a support beam gives way, burying Jack, The Ripper, alive. Cloak, and Dagger, survey Times Square, in search of criminal activity. Five armed individuals chase after a trio. Cloak, and Dagger, subdue the five seeming criminals, only to learn that they are actually undercover police officers. Dagger harshly criticizes Cloak's judgment. Cloak teleports away. Dagger searches for Cloak, at the Holy Ghost Church. Father Delgado, believing Cloak to be a demon, tries to drive a wedge between Cloak, and Dagger.

Delgado convinces Dagger to suspend her search, and get some rest. Cloak appears. Rather than inform Dagger of Cloak's presence, Delgado hurls holy water on Cloak. To Cloak's surprise, the holy water burns him. Cloak teleports away. Cloak wonders if, in fact, he is a demon. Doubting his judgment, Cloak refuses to intervene against further criminal acts, witnessed during the night. Cloak's crisis of conscience troubles the demonic Predator which actually resides within Cloak. The Predator feeds on the life energy of the criminals that Cloak absorbs, as well as Dagger's light, which she freely gives Cloak. If Cloak ceases to use his power, the Predator faces starvation.

The Predator dwells on the origin of Cloak, and Dagger. Tandy Bowen, and Tyrone Johnson, were runaways, who were given an experimental form of heroin. All the other test subjects died. Bowen, and Johnson, gained super-powers, becoming Cloak, and Dagger. The Predator takes direct action to force Cloak to feed him. As Cloak walks away from an assault, a strange emerald fog emerges from his cloak. The fog engulfs the would-be killer, transforming him into Jack, The Ripper. Much to the Predator's chagrin, Jack,The Ripper, refuses to follow his orders. Dagger is furious when she discovers that Delgado did not inform her of Cloak's presence. Dagger searches New York, for Cloak.

The police try to arrest Dagger, who flees from them. Under the influence of Jack, The Ripper's, unearthly power, a fog blankets parts of New York, transforming it into 19th Century London. The effect convinces Cloak that he is losing his sanity. Lost in "London", Cloak fruitlessly search for the Holy Ghost Church. Jack, The Ripper, goes on a killing spree. The Predator tries to sway Jack, The Ripper, to his side, to no avail. Dagger believes that Cloak is responsible for Jack, The Ripper's crimes. Cloak begins to believe that he is responsible for Jack, The Ripper's, murders. The Predator tries to force Cloak to feed him, to no avail. Dagger pursues Cloak. The Predator rails at Jack, The Ripper.

Cloak tries to commit suicide by forcing police officers to fire on him. Cloak, however, is immune to gunfire. Jack, The Ripper, murders the police officers. Discovering the bodies, Dagger is convinced of Cloak's guilt. Dagger confronts Cloak. Dagger pours all of her light energy into Cloak. At first, the Predator is ecstatic, but the light proves too overwhelming, forcing the Predator to withdraw further inside Cloak, or risk being consumed. Cloak does not die, but rather loses all of his powers, reverting back to Johnson. Jack, The Ripper, feeds on Dagger's light, sustaining his spirit on the mortal plane. From Jack, The Ripper, Cloak learns that he, himself, is not a demon, but rather a gatekeeper, for a demon that lives within his darkness.

Cloak's power gradually returns. Cloak absorbs Jack, The Ripper, with Dagger following. The Predator punishes Jack, The Ripper, for his defiance. Dagger tries to destroy the Predator, but her light energy is largely spent. Dagger exits Cloak's dimension of darkness. With a better understanding of Cloak's powers, Dagger promises to stand by his side. Delgado, driven mad by his obsession with Dagger, and hatred of Cloak, is committed. Cloak, and Dagger, return to their home, the Holy Ghost Church.
name: Cloak & Dagger: Predator & Prey

description:
The capital city, Port Anteris, on the planet Wilamean, in the Andromeda Galaxy. A drunken spy is brought before the Emperor, Arimathes. The drunken spy reveals all the intelligence he has gathered on Hercules, Prince of Power. Unsatisfied with the mere history of Hercules, Arimathes orders the spy's execution. The spy reports on a recent battle between Hercules, and his father, Zeus. Arimathes considers that last bit of intelligence to be of use. After ascertaining that Hercules did, in fact, visit Port Anteris some thirty years ago, Arimathes orders Hercules' arrest. At the moment, Hercules is in his seventy-fifth hour of revelry, at the Greasy Turbine Café.

After winning yet another arm wrestling contest, Hercules is alerted to the arrival of Galactus. The population of Wilamean begins emergency evacuation procedures. Arimathes' guards arrive to arrest Hercules. Galactus makes planet fall. Hercules is placed under arrest, Hercules' arrest is postponed to allow the Prince Of Power to deal with the threat from Galactus. Hercules confronts Galactus. When Galactus refuses to respond to Hercules, the Prince Of Power attacks. Galactus pops. Hercules storms Galactus's ship. The vessel proves to be hollow, concealing a smaller command ship. Hercules storms the command ship, revealing the culprits behind the Galactus ruse, Alpo and Clyde, a pair of intergalactic thieves.

Hercules reminisces over his first encounter with the pair, before turning them over to the authorities. Hercules allows himself to be placed back under arrest. Hercules is brought before the Emperor, Arimathes. The Emperor Mother confirms Hercules' identity. After a brief interrogation, Arimathes has Hercules struck down, then incarcerated. Arimathes reveals that Hercules is his father. While imprisoned, Hercules meets Mallax Fortnite, the former military commander of a conquered planet. Fortnite reveals Armathes' plan to invade the Omacron System. The Emperor Mother enters. The Emperor Mother reveals her identity, that of Layana Sweetwater.

Thirty years ago, Sweetwater duped Hercules into a conflict with Count Igwanus. Sweetwater's treachery was revealed, but not before Hercules had left her with child. A child that, twisted by Sweetwater's lies and malice, has grown to hate his father. Gegku rebels attempt to assassinate the Emperor. Arimathes slaughters them all. Count Igwanus is revealed to be a servant to the Emperor Mother. Hercules convinces Count Igwanus to free him, and several of his comrades. Fortnite releases Lucynda Thrust, a starship pirate. Skyppi, the Skrull, assumes the appearance of the Emperor Mother. The "Emperor Mother" leads the prisoners past the guards.

After a brief hiccup in the elevator, Hercules' band of escapees make their way to one of Arimathes' starships. The Emperor addresses his armies, before they depart for the Omacron System. Rather than escaping, Hercules intends to stop the Emperor's fleet from attacking the Omacron System. With the Emperor's fleet fast approaching, the Omacron System mounts it's only defense, the Star Cavalry. Hopelessly outnumbered, the Star Cavalry has no chance to prevail against the Emperor's fleet. Thrust threatens to murder one of the Emperor's soliders, unless he reveals the fleet's communication codes. Skyppi, the Skrull, impersonating the Emperor, orders the fleet to stand down.

Hercules openly challenges the Emperor. On a large planetoid, Hercules prepares to face his son, Arimathes, in combat. To teach Arimathes a lesson in humility, Hercules fights him blindfolded. After an epic battle, Hercules is triumphant. Arimathes' armies declare Hercules the Emperor. Hercules helps Arimathes to his feet. Hercules' words reach Arimathes' twisted heart. Hercules declares Arimathes to be a new king. Finally seeing how hatred has poisoned his mother, Arimathes has the Emperor Mother confined to the north wing of the royal palace. Hercules' heart swells with pride for his newfound son.
name: Hercules Prince Of Power: Full Circle

description: The international adventure continues! Storm Shadow has many people after him and the family secrets he holds -- both new and familiar faces - all of whom want him dead! The chase leads everyone to Tokyo and right into the hands of the Yakuza! High adventure! Great action! Big danger!

He's been chased around the world - enemies from every side trying to get the information he holds... a deadly family secret protected for centuries. As the international chase comes to New York City, familiar faces crop up in some surprising ways! Will Storm Shadow be able to stay a step ahead of them all?

When his travels take him to Germany, Storm Shadow finds himself stuck in a situation with an angry, fanatical patriot and his army of incredible - and deadly - battle androids! Seems that not everyone was happy when the wall came down... It's ninjitsu vs. technology!

After decades, Gumby and Pokey return in an all-new, full-color series, written and drawn by the Eisner Award-winning team of Bob Burden and Rick Geary! In this first charming and surreal adventure, Gumby and his friends help some mistreated circus clowns escape, only to find out why the nasty buggers were restrained in the first place, after the wicked funsters go on a rampage! Also, the little green boy suffers his first twinge of a crush!
name: Gumby

description: In the Winter of 1152, the Guard face a food and supply shortage threatening the lives of many through a cold and icy season. Saxon, Kenzie, Lieam, and Sadie, led by Celanawe, traverse the snow-blanketed territories acting as diplomats to improve relations between the mouse cities and the Guard. This is a winter not every Guard may survive!
name: The Storm Is Getting Worse

person_credits.name: David Petersen
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Bob Burden and Rick Geary once again take the reader deep into Gumby's world, as only these two can. This time, Gumby hops a ride with some hobo's in search of his pal Pokey, only to land smack dab in the middle of "The Town With No Fun!" It is a guaranteed great time for everyone, young and old.
name: Behold the Golem!

description: While the witches fend off Lilith's demon, their fragile bonds disintegrate. Dr. Strange tries to keep the brood together but he struggles with his own declining strength as a result of the demon's presence. And the true nature of the demon and its purpose on Earth is revealed.
name: The Test

description: While the girls attempt to rescue Jennifer from the demon, Strange has his own problems with an old adversary. The struggle concludes and hidden agendas are exposed in this thrilling final issue.

name: What Am I Going To Do Now? My Parents Don't Even Love Me Anymore!

description: In the midst of a bitter cold winter storm, the party of Guard mice headed toward Lockhaven with supplies and medicine is split apart. Saxon, Kenzie, and Sadie find themselves below the snowy surface in dark and menacing tunnels mice rarely escape from, while Celanawe and Lieam continue the push towards home and cement their mutual respect for one another.
name: I'm...I'm Slipping...

person_credits.name: David Petersen
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: The Black Axe Celanawe and Young Mouse Guard Lieam dig into the snowy landscape for shelter during an ice storm, and the horrible weather leaves them with fewer supplies than before. The Guard mice Saxon, Kenzie, and Sadie - trapped below the surface in the weasel homeworld of Darkheather - upset the nocturnal inhabitants there. Saxon takes drastic measures and gets carried away!
name: Conall, My Little Friend... Do You Have Something There For Me?

person_credits.name: David Petersen
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover
